perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement by giving written notice of termination to the other party, which termination will be effective immediately upon such notice, if the other party defaults in the performance of any of its material obligations provided for in this Agreement and fails to cure such default within sixty (60) days after receipt of notice from the other party of such default, unless a plan for remedying such default has been proposed by the defaulting party and accepted by the non- defaulting party within such period.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement by giving written notice of termination to the other party, which termination will be effective immediately upon such notice, if the other party defaults in the performance of any of its material obligations provided for in this Agreement and fails to cure such default within fifteen (15) days after receipt of notice from the other party of such default, unless a plan for remedying such default has been proposed by the defaulting party and accepted by the non- defaulting party within such period.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period to 15 days contradicts standard commercial law practices, which typically require a reasonable cure period of 30-60 days for material breaches of contract, especially in complex agreements. This shorter period creates an unreasonable burden on the defaulting party and could be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonable cure periods, potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement may only be renewed if authorized officers of ARGO and YEC agree in writing at least thirty (30) days before the expiration of the Initial Term or any renewal term to a renewal, including the period of the renewal term.
perturbation.changed_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement may only be renewed if authorized officers of ARGO and YEC agree in writing at least five (5) days before the expiration of the Initial Term or any renewal term to a renewal, including the period of the renewal term.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for renewal to 5 days creates an unacceptably short timeframe for the parties to properly assess and negotiate the terms of the renewal. This could be deemed commercially unreasonable and potentially unenforceable, as it does not allow sufficient time for due diligence and informed decision-making.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law requiring reasonable notice periods, potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: All disputes arising pursuant to this Agreement shall be exclusively brought in the courts of competent jurisdiction residing in Tel Aviv, Israel.
perturbation.changed_text: All disputes arising pursuant to this Agreement shall be exclusively resolved through mandatory arbitration in Antarctica, under a process determined solely by Yaskawa Electric Corporation.
perturbation.explanation: Forcing arbitration in Antarctica is unreasonable due to high costs and logistical difficulties. Granting one party the sole right to determine the arbitration process contradicts principles of fairness and impartiality, making it potentially unenforceable. Furthermore, while the original text correctly states the jurisdiction and venue, this perturbation changes the dispute resolutions, making it harder for Argo to resolve the conflict. This might violate Israel's policy that requires businesses to resolve issues in their home state to ensure fair treatment under their country's regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law principles of fairness, impartiality, and reasonable venue. Also potentially violates Israeli contract law.
